content: This app does not treat the Location permission "Allow while only using the app" properly. Instead, it needs to to be allowed all the time otherwise the app fails to load.
replyContent: The widget needs background location permission to detect location. It's a good point though. If you only use the app then "allow only when using the app" would be sufficient. Thanks for bringing this to my attention. EDIT new version 4.1.0 (now fully released in the Play Store) has better handling of this... please try it when you get the update.

content: I would consider amputating a limb before letting go of this app. It has been my most viewed weather app for years now. It is stable, reliable and the most customizable app on the entire Google play store Pantheon; a tweaker's dream. The developer's attentive and dedicated support of this app is concrete, long-term and responsive & backed by consistent regular updates. My only fear is that someday the developer may sell it to a competitor like IBM.
replyContent: The only way IBM will get it from me is to grab it from my cold, dead hands.  Or offer me $1M.  Thanks for the review!

content: Not worth ¬£15 when there are so many that are cheaper & better, I paid for this app & I certainly don't appreciate having to pay more with in app purchases, so much so that I don't even use this app anymore, so yes you are cash grabbing simple as, they charge you so we buy the app, it don't mean to say we want to pay more on IAP's!! Donk!
replyContent: Having already bought the pro version, if you want access to the paid data sources (entirely optional) then it's ¬£1.50 a year.  If you don't think the time and effort put in by the developer is worth ¬£1.50 a year then by all means use another app... it will mean less load on the servers and less weather data usage (neither of which come free).

content: What is the point of having such an expensive weather app where nearly all of the weather providers available need a "platinum" subscription. Rubbish cash grab.
replyContent: You can use all the effort I've put into this app for free, if that's what your philosophy in life is.  And the paid weather providers are those that charge me for their data, so do you expect me to fund this personally?  I don't appreciate accusations of cash grab... it's barely enough to pay for data and hosting costs so get your facts straight.

content: Unfathomable
replyContent: Most users find that taking a bit of time to understand the possibilities leads to great rewards, but if you want an app that shows one weather symbol per day, without any effort, then this probably isn't for you.

content: Fantastic app with sooo much to customize! Saw some reviews (from dullards, no doubt) that complained about this. Many other negative reviews are from people who don't know how to use the available settings‚Äîtypical Play Store user behavior.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback!  Yes, unfortunately some users don't really understand the philosophy behind the app... it's not particularly intended for those who like a one-button interface and one weather symbol per day.

content: Been using Meteogram for a few months now. Has a lot of settings and it's a very nice app with regular updates. One thing I would say is at first look it's very complex, but setting up a widget is not hard as there are pre made ones, add temperature, wind, etc as needed. Over time play more. It has a lot of options & settings but learn them over time & as you workout all the features, what they can do & how to use them the ability becomes easier to use & then much more powerful. GREAT APP!
replyContent:
Thank you very much for your thoughtful review.  As you say, start simple, then build from there
  Your imagination is the limit!

I think most users will find the app too complicated. There's just too many

content:
I have been trying to find an app with all my weather needs in a graph 
format. Pressure, wind speed, Solunar phases, precip and rise/set for both 
sun and moon.... this has it all and it goes 200 + hours out in the future. 
There is nothing that even touches this app in regards to the data outputs 
I want much less the vast configuration options. I only wish i would have 
found it sooner. The only thing I can't give up from another app is the 
ability to have the next 60 minutes precip from Dark Skies app. That 
feature shows me the hyper local weather so I don't get stuck in the rain 
with my equipment. That one extra piece would make Meteogram the only app 
to ever use for weather. Still as is, the best weather app there is, is 
Meteogram
replyContent: Thank you so much for your great feedback!  Hyperlocal weather is something I've been considering for a long time, I just haven't figured out how to integrate it nicely.  There is already the option in the app to get weather data from dark sky... I just haven't yet made use of the hyperlocal part of it.  Feel free to keep bugging me about it!

content: A fantastic app with more features and settings no mere mortal can remember them all to put down on here.     A well layed out app, thoughtfully interpreted onto your device in a multitude of ways for your hearts desire, so you can prioritise what feature is most important to you on any particular season or day of the week.     A fine example of how a whether information service should be made to work for the customer, and not what is thought is a more simple service to be built for the advantage of the development team.     Excellent app.

content: Don't use the widget so I won't comment.  I use met.no as a weather source for Canada (Toronto Beach) and forecast is accurate. Completely customizable -  you can load any sort of weather Info onto graph. Can change time frame of chart, which is good because at 72 hours it gets a bit small.  Takes a little getting used to read all the info, but then it's really efficient to glance at upcoming day or two forecast.  App never crashes or fails to load or refresh data. Doesn't seem to use battery excessively.
replyContent: Thanks so much for the thoughtful and informative review.  If you have any suggestions for improvement,  then please let me know.

content: A simple feature request.  Android 6 allows the app to be moved to the inserted SD card and I've got a 64Gb card in my phone.  Could an app update be released that allows your app to be moved to "external storage" as Android 6 describes it?
replyContent: The latest beta version (just released) allows installation to SD card.  But note that if the SD card is unmounted the widget will probably disappear and not come back until after the SD card is remounted AND the device is rebooted.

content: Such potential: 5 star app, 4 star settings!  But, there are a number of inconsistencies and hassles.  For example, the app defaults to metric and, there isn't a single setting to change all measurements at once.  What makes this worse is that when you import shared settings (other peoples "cards"), it affects all settings, whereas certain settings should be immutable (like, metric or imperial measurements).  As stated in other reviews, the settings are numerous, but there is no settings' search to help you locate something specific, quickly.  Like I said, the app is getting there, but it hasn't quite arrived - the settings need to be tweaked a bit more.  There should be an easier way to import cards, too, for example.  Instead of importing and exporting all settings to share charts, the "card" idea should be further developed.  Again, not all settings should be affected when importing a chart.  I'll keep it around, but I do hope it is made more user friendly. NOTE: Raised 1 star for developer's fast and positive response. EDIT: LOL, how can I refuse!
replyContent:
Thanks for the great feedback... I really appreciate it, and will definitely consider your thoughts when improving on the current settings interface in future.  EDIT if I respond quickly again, will you raise it again by 1 star?  ;-) 
 EDIT2: high five!  now there's an even bigger incentive to implement the improvements you suggest!  Thanks again.

content: Error "failed loading data..." when the app is launched.

Saw this on sale for free today, I must say it's worth the asking price easily, I figure the least I can do is give this quick run down as well as highly recommend this, the best weather widget you can buy!  Thank you developers for your awesome work!

Info so I'll contact you later. I can translate it in the weekend for you since I'm very busy with traveling and working and don't feel like it when I'm tired after a day of work. content: This is the most customizable weather widget in the market. I can think of just a few things that could be improved: 1. The widget displays a picture that freezes if there is no connection. Can the app preload a set of pictures to scroll them as the time goes? 2. The widget could be tweaked to be more minimalistic with a setting to disable "fetching" and "decoding" briefly showing on top of the widget. 3. AccuWeather detects neighbourhood within the city to show a more targeted forecast. Meteogram with AccuWeather provider shows the city. It would be great to have the location as granular as the provider supports. If the provider already returns neighbourhood-precise data, then the displayed location name could be updated.  Thank you for the great app!
replyContent: Thanks for this really useful feedback.  (1) yes at some point I'd like to do something like this.  (2) good idea... maybe some prefer not having these update messages.  (3) if the location reported by the phone's GPS is accurate, that full accuracy is passed on to AccuWeather to get the data... running out of space... please email to continue!

content: Your answer is required. The program is my main source of Wx information. Yesterday for what ever reason it stopped functioning. I tried the widget, with the same result. Could it be the Last Updateüòà. It worked beautifully for the last month or so. If you need specific info pls let me know. Kind regards, Charles............You have earned the üåûüåûüåûüåûüåû The FIX came within 30 minutes, it's an unusual response on the POSITIVE side. Last but not least a program with exceptional accuracy. Thank you, Charles
replyContent: It was a temporary issue that has been fixed.  Please save your widget settings (to file or server), clear the app data in Application Manager, reload widget settings.  That should do it.  Or else the "bad" data will clear automatically in time once the cache period has expired.  Let me know how it goes.  EDIT glad it's back to normal.

content: I love the app, but the fact that the widget is always invisible when I turn on my tablet really annoys me. l have to enter edit mode to make it visible. REPLY: What happens when you tap the top left corner of the widget (this is a quick way of forcing a refresh)? - When it's invisible, nothing happens when I tap the top left corner of where the widget is supposed to be; when I come out of edit mode and it's visible again, I tap the top left corner and it updates correctly. Also, when it's invisible, and you go into settings, right at the bottom in the App Info section, what does the "next widget update" time read? - Next widget refresh: ~16:40-16:46 (it's currently 16:17) EDIT: Problem solved, amazing service from the developers :)
replyContent: What happens when you tap the top left corner of the widget (this is a quick way of forcing a refresh)?  When it's invisible, what does the "next widget update" time read in the App Info section?  EDIT In the Advanced Settings section, could you please try using a different combo of settings?  EDIT2: woohoo, glad we got it working!

content: This app contains a wealth of short term weather forecast information and is highly customizable. You can choose which elements of the weather you want to follow on the meteogram and which ones to ignore, thus preventing it from becoming cluttered with information. Another nice feature is that there is a choice of weather providers, allowing weather enthusiasts like myself to experiment over time and determine which provider tends to be more accurate. Overall, this is one of the best weather apps I've used.
